results.adx_keywords: Colon and Colorectal Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Clinical Trials;Research;Immunotherapy;Dostarlimab (Drug);American Society of Clinical Oncology;New England Journal of Medicine;GlaxoSmithKline PLC
results.title: A Cancer Trial’s Unexpected Result: Remission in Every Patient
results.abstract: The study was small, and experts say it needs to be replicated. But for 18 people with rectal cancer, the outcome led to “happy tears.”

media.caption: Sascha Roth, the first patient in the trial, unexpectedly learned she had rectal cancer in 2019. Her gastroenterologist, she recalled, told her during a sigmoidoscopy, “Oh no. I was notexpecting this!”
media.copyright: Shuran Huang for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Treason and Sedition;United States Politics and Government;Tarrio, Enrique;Pezzola, Dominic;Nordean, Ethan;Biggs, Joseph (1984- );Proud Boys;Oath Keepers;Justice Department
results.byline: By Alan Feuer, Adam Goldman and Luke Broadwater
results.title: Proud Boys Charged With Sedition in Capitol Attack
results.abstract: An amended federal indictment charged five members of the far-right group, including Enrique Tarrio, its former leader, with seditious conspiracy for their roles in the Jan. 6 assault.

media.caption: Enrique Tarrio, the former leader of the Proud Boys, was not in Washington on Jan. 6, 2021. But prosecutors have said he “led the advance planning and remained in contact with other members of the Proud Boys” during the Capitol riot.
media.copyright: Eva Marie Uzcategui/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: Mass Shooting in Philadelphia Kills at Least 3 on Weekend of Gun Violence
results.abstract: Shootings in Tennessee, Virginia, Arizona and South Carolina left six more dead and dozens injured.

results.title: Democrats Can Win This Fall if They Make One Key Promise
results.abstract: To make the 2022 elections a referendum on Roe, Democrats have to put protecting Roe and abortion rights on the table.

results.title: It’s Been 50 Years. I Am Not ‘Napalm Girl’ Anymore.
results.abstract: The surviving people in war photographs, especially the children, must somehow go on. We are not symbols. We are human.

media.caption: The author at her home in Ontario.
media.copyright: May Truong for The New York Times

results.title: Biden Has ‘Only Bad Options’ for Bringing Down Oil Prices
results.abstract: The president’s trip to Saudi Arabia is unlikely to reduce oil and gasoline prices, and it is not clear that anything else he might do would work, either.

media.caption: An oil terminal at the seaport of Ras Tanura in Saudi Arabia.

results.adx_keywords: School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Gun Control;Mass Shootings;Law and Legislation;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;United States Politics and Government;Suffolk County (NY)
results.byline: By Andy Newman, Benjamin Weiser and Ashley Southall
results.title: How a New York County Used the State’s ‘Red Flag’ Law to Seize 160 Guns
results.abstract: Suffolk County on Long Island aggressively uses the law to take guns from people in crisis in an effort to prevent shootings and suicides. Its experience could inform a national debate.

media.caption: The massacre at a Buffalo supermarket raised questions about why the suspect had not been subject to a red flag order. Such orders are most widely used in New York in Suffolk County.

results.adx_keywords: Gun Control;Firearms;Everytown for Gun Safety;Moms Demand Action;Orlando (Fla)
results.title: Mother Charged With Manslaughter After 2-Year-Old Fatally Shoots Father
results.abstract: It is unclear how the boy managed to get the Glock 19, but his mother acknowledged that “any child in the room could have figured out how to get the gun out of the bag,” the authorities said.

media.caption: A Glock 19, the same model gun used in an accidental shooting by a 2-year-old, on display at the National Rifle Association’s annual meeting.
media.copyright: Patrick T. Fallon/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Grain;Ships and Shipping;Food;Embargoes and Sanctions;International Trade and World Market;Shortages;Sall, Macky;African Union;Russia;Ukraine;Africa
results.byline: By Declan Walsh and Valerie Hopkins
results.title: Russia Seeks Buyers for Plundered Ukraine Grain, U.S. Warns
results.abstract: American diplomats have alerted 14 countries, most in Africa, that Russian ships filled with stolen Ukrainian grain could be headed their way, posing a dilemma to countries facing dire food shortages.

media.caption: A satellite image showing a bulk carrier ship taking on grain at the Russian-controlled port of Sevastopol, Crimea, on May 19.

results.adx_keywords: State Legislatures;States (US);Constitution (US);United States Politics and Government;Supreme Court (US)
results.title: Supreme Court May Hear ‘800-Pound Gorilla’ of Election Law Cases
results.abstract: Next week the justices will consider whether to resolve a long-simmering dispute about the power of state legislatures in federal elections.

media.caption: The independent state legislature doctrine, as it is often called, would give state legislatures independent power, not subject to review by state courts, to set election rules and draw congressional maps.
media.copyright: Tom Brenner for The New York Times

results.title: Mongols Motorcycle Club Says Its Leader Was an Informant
results.abstract: The biker group hopes to set aside a $500,000 racketeering conviction, alleging that its former president cooperated with the government during a trial.
org_facet: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

media.caption: David Santillan, the president of the Mongols, was ousted by the group after a video surfaced that implied he was being protected by a federal agent.
media.copyright: Michael Tyrone Delaney for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Fines (Penalties);Economic Conditions and Trends;Johnson, Boris;Conservative Party (Great Britain);Great Britain
results.title: How Boris Johnson Shattered His Own Invincibility
results.abstract: The prime minister survived a no-confidence vote, but has been politically wounded by the same baffling mix of strengths and foibles that propelled his rise: rare political intuition, and breathtaking personal recklessness.

media.caption: Rebels in the conservative party have called for a no-confidence vote that could cost Prime Minister Boris Johnson his job.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Burke, Glenn (1952-95);Tampa Bay Rays;Los Angeles Dodgers;Major League Baseball
results.title: An Attempt at Inclusion Proves There Is More Work to Do
results.abstract: A day after the Dodgers finally embraced the memory of Glenn Burke — Major League Baseball’s first gay player — a group of Rays players undercut their team’s Pride Night.

media.caption: The Tampa Bay Rays wore rainbow insignias on their caps and jerseys on Saturday. Five players chose not to participate.

results.title: I Married the Wrong Person, and I’m So Glad I Did

results.title: Elon Musk threatens to end Twitter deal without information on fake accounts.

results.title: Struggling in Ukraine’s East, Russian Forces Strike in Kyiv

results.title: New York Officials Fear Supreme Court Ruling Will Mean More Gun Crime
results.abstract: The Supreme Court is expected to rule on — and possibly overturn — a century-old law that allows local officials great discretion over who can carry a handgun.

media.caption: The New York Police Department has recovered more than 3,000 guns this year.
media.copyright: Dakota Santiago for The New York Times
